item.title: Linear Models for Regression - Linear Basis Function Models : Part 1
item.description: Linear regression model has the property of being linear functions of adjustable parameters. We can add more complexity in the linear regression models by taking linear combinations of a fixed set of nonlinear functions of the input variables, known as basis functions. In the modeling process, giveb $x$, we have to predict $t$ which can be predicted as $y(x)$. Form a probabilistic prespective, we aim to model the predictive distribution $p(t|x)$ as this expresses the uncertainty about the value of $t$ for each value of $x$.
